p: The current pandemic that struck the world in December 2019 and is ongoing till this day, has turned into the deadliest pandemic after influenza pandemic that took place in 1918. This is the third time that a coronavirus has caused an outbreak during the 21st century. The recent one is caused by the novel coronavirus termed as the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) by the World Health Organization (WHO) and is responsible for a respiratory disease named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). However, COVID-19 has turned out to be more deadly than the previously spread SARS and MERS (Middle east respiratory syndrome) coronaviruses. Owing to this, 1.30 million people have died because of COVID-19 and 53.76 million have tested positive for the virus as of November 13, 2020 ( Worldometer 2020). The reason that it took only over two months to be declared as “pandemic” is the interconnectedness and ever increased worldwide travel.
